name: relevant_year
description:
Year information in the message relates to. Important to ensure that information is entered correctly at the transition to the new year.

Data generated from a database with a base in the DA+TI element in the message Made by the system in the Directorate of Fisheries Used to make data searchable.

name: message_year
description:
Year information in the message relates to. Important to ensure that information is entered correctly at the transition to the new year.

Data generated from a database with a base in the DA+TI element in the message Made by the system in the Directorate of Fisheries Used to make data searchable.

name: message_type_code
description:
Which message a vessel is required to send depends on which danger waters/zone the vessel is active in. In any case, Norwegian vessels are required to send a number of reports to the Norwegian authorities in accordance with national regulations. If a vessel is active in another country's zone, it can

Three-letter code indicating the type of message. Required field

Only known values specified in regulations

Content in reception is checked against message type in various tests.

name: message_type
description:
Which message a vessel is required to send depends on which danger waters/zone the vessel is active in. In any case, Norwegian vessels are required to send a number of reports to the Norwegian authorities in accordance with national regulations. If a vessel is active in another country's zone, it can

Three-letter code indicating the type of message. Required field

Only known values specified in regulations

Content in reception is checked against message type in various tests.

name: message_number
description:
Serial number for the message in the current year. The notification number is unique for the individual vessel in the year (starts anew every year), while the number series for foreign vessels, in accordance with concluded agreements, is built up as the time for generating a notification at the flag state

This is a counter that starts at 1 every year. The count and number increase by 1 for each message that is sent, regardless of the final recipient of the message. Required field in all messages

Generated by the system.

Used to identify messages in the system.

name: message_version
description:
Integer showing the version number of the received message. Only capture messages (DCA) contain this variable upon receipt. The Directorate of Fisheries automatically sets the value 1 when received by other message types.


Optional element

New message version will completely replace the previous version and must therefore contain all message data

This number increases by 1 for each change to the message. Used in connection with correction of the message.

name: sequence_number
description:
Serial number for the report each year between a specific vessel and recipient (coastal state or international fisheries management organisation). Numbering begins anew each year. Fisker himself indicates the final recipient (FT).

This is a counter that starts at 1 every year. The count and number increase by 1 for each message sent to a third party. Optional within NS

Filled in by the system on board.

name: message_id
description:
Unique identification that is automatically added to the individual message upon receipt by the Directorate of Fisheries. Unique key for linking with other ERS tables.

Running series generated by time stored in the database

System generated with reception

name: message_timestamp
description:
Date and time the message was sent in UTC.

Date and time are obtained from the GPS on board. Required fields in all messages.

Retrieved from GPS on board

Must specify an exact time for posting the item. Used in reception to check items related to time

name: message_date
description:
Date and time the message was sent in UTC.

Date and time are obtained from the GPS on board. Required fields in all messages.

Retrieved from GPS on board

Must specify an exact time for posting the item. Used in reception to check items related to time.

name: message_hour
description:
Date and time the message was sent in UTC.

Date and time are obtained from the GPS on board. Required fields in all messages.

Retrieved from GPS on board

Must specify an exact time for posting the item. Used in reception to check items related to time

name: callsign_ers
description:
The vessel's radio call sign. Documentation of Norwegian radio callsigns can be found in the vessel table.

Vessel ID entered with a combination of letters and numbers. Required field.

Located in admin on application on board the boat

Message authentication is dependent on this identification. Without a link there, the origin of the message is not confirmed.

name: shipname_ers
description:
Name of the vessel.

Optional element

Entered by the skipper as a free text field.

The element's properties give the accuracy some uncertainty.

name: registry_ers
description:
The vessel's registration number.

Optional element

This is an identification that is given to Norwegian fishing vessels that are registered in the Brand Register at Can be entered in various ways that have an effect on the quality of this element.

name: vessel_flag
description:
Vessel nationality (code): Flag State sender

The vessel's flag state. Not specified for Norwegian vessels. NB

Sent from other flag states than NOR

name: vessel_flag_group_code
description:
N = Norwegian, U = Foreign and T = Test.



Grouping of vessels based on nationality and status. Generated with a background in the radio callsign to Found only in the Directorate of Fisheries' register

name: vessel_flag_group
description:
Vessel Group

Grouping of vessels based on nationality and status. Generated with a background in the radio callsign to Found only in the Directorate of Fisheries' register

name: quota_type_code
description:
If fishing is carried out on several fishing permits within a 24-hour period, separate catch reports (DCA) must be sent.

Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

Value is retrieved from a list

The values are found as appendix no. 5 in the regulation

name: quota_type
description:
If fishing is carried out on several fishing permits within a 24-hour period, separate catch reports (DCA) must be sent.

Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

Value is retrieved from a list

The values are found as appendix no. 5 in the regulation

name: activity_code
description:
For some vessels, not all codes are relevant.

Required field in all DCAs.

The value is retrieved from a list.

The values can be found as an appendix no. 6 in the regulation

name: activity
description:
For some vessels, not all codes are relevant.

Required field in all DCAs.

The value is retrieved from a list.

The values can be found as an appendix no. 6 in the regulation

name: port_code
description:
International code for the port of call, ISO alpha 2 country code + 3 letter port code UN/LOCODE (The United Nations code for Trade and Transport Locations.)

Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

Value is retrieved from a list

Official port list of valid codes published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website.

name: port_name
description:
International code for the port of call, ISO alpha 2 country code + 3 letter port code UN/LOCODE (The United Nations code for Trade and Transport Locations.)

Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

Value is retrieved from a list

Official port list of valid codes published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website.

name: port_nacionality
description:
International code for the port of call, ISO alpha 2 country code + 3 letter port code UN/LOCODE (The United Nations code for Trade and Transport Locations.)

Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

Value is retrieved from a list

Official port list of valid codes published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website.

name: timestamp_start_activity
description:
Start timestamp: Date and time of fishing start

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing start

Required data

name: date_start_activity
description:
Start date: Date and time of fishing start

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing start

Required data

name: hour_start_activity
description:
Start time: Date and time of fishing start

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing start

Required data

name: lat_start_activity
description:
Start position latitude: Position latitude

Position latitude at start of fishing operation +/- DD.ddd (WGS-84)

Required data if the vessel has set fishing gear in the sea. Required field

Retrieved from GPS on board

name: lon_start_activity
description:
Start position longitude: Position  longitude

Position longitude at start of fishing operation +/- DDD.ddd (WGS-84)

Required data if the vessel has set fishing gear in the sea. Required field

Retrieved from GPS on board

Values are entered in the message with the correct format.

name: main_area_start_activity_code
description:
Main area start (code): Location where fishing operation has started

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

System-generated zone by the Directorate of Fisheries

Automatic

Relevant up to the final note

name: main_area_start_activity_name
description:
Main area start: Location where fishing operation has started

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

System-generated zone by the Directorate of Fisheries

7
Automatic

Relevant up to the final note

name: location_start_activity_code
description:
Location start (code): Location where the fishing operation has started

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

System-generated zone by the Directorate of Fisheries

Automatic

Relevant up to the final note

name: zone_code
description:
Zone (code): Zone

Zone designation (ICES) where fishing operations are carried out. The information consists of the three-letter nation code in addition to the three-letter code for composite areas (starting with the letter X) when the zone is shared by several nations. Code table KODEEIER.NS_OKONOMISK_SON

Economic zone indicated by the skipper from a list from the Directorate of Fisheries where fishing has been carried out

The skipper selects this manually

Used to check activity in regulations where this is relevant.

name: zone_name
description:
Zone: Zone

Zone designation (ICES) where fishing operations are carried out. The information consists of the three-letter nation code in addition to the three-letter code for composite areas (starting with the letter X) when the zone is shared by several nations. Code table KODEEIER.NS_OKONOMISK_SON

Economic zone indicated by the skipper from a list from the Directorate of Fisheries where fishing has been carried out

The skipper selects this manually

Used to check activity in regulations where this is relevant.

name: area_grouping_start_activity_code
description: Area grouping start code [områdegruppering.start..kode.]

name: area_grouping_start_activity_name
description: Area grouping start name [områdegruppering.start]

name: depth_start_activity
description:
Sea depth start: Start zone

Another level for zone indication

System-generated zone by the Directorate of Fisheries

Automatic

Used to check activity in regulations where this is relevant

name: timestamp_stop_activity
description:
Stop timestamp: Date and time of fishing stop

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing stop

Required data

name: date_stop_activity
description:
Stop date: Date and time of fishing stop

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing stop

Required data

name: hour_stop_activity
description:
Stop time: Date and time of fishing stop

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing stop

Required data

name: duration_activity
description:
Duration: Duration

Duration of the fishing operation in minutes

Is required if you have had gear in the sea. The definition of fishing operation is based on the clearly defined times for start and stop.

The time between the start and end of a fishing operation

The vessels sometimes enter tail time instead of the length of the fishing operation. Marine research can use this for CPUE calculations.

name: year_reference
description:
Catch year: Date and time of start of fishing

Date (YYYYMMDD) and time (TTMM) of fishing start

Required data

name: lat_stop_activity
description:
Stop position latitude: Position latitude

Position latitude at end of fishing operation +/- DD.ddd (WGS-84)

Required data

Retrieved from the GPS on board, when the skipper presses Stop in the Application.

The time is specified in the definition of what a capture operation is.

name: lon_stop_activity
description:
Stop position longitude: Position  longitude

Position longitude at end of fishing operation +/- DDD.ddd (WGS-84)

Required data as the final element of a fishing operation

Retrieved from the GPS on board, when the skipper presses Stop in the Application.

The time is specified in the definition of what a capture operation is.

name: main_area_stop_activity_code
description:
Main area stop (code): Location where fishing operation ended

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

Done by the system in the Norwegian Directorate of Fisheries automatically based on locations found in the system System generated with receipt

Used to link values to activity in different locations.

name: main_area_stop_activity_name
description:
Main area stop: Location where fishing operation ended

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

Done by the system in the Norwegian Directorate of Fisheries automatically based on locations found in the system System generated with receipt

Used to link values to activity in different locations.

name: location_stop_activity_code
description:
Location stop (code): Location where fishing operation ended

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

Done by the system in the Norwegian Directorate of Fisheries automatically based on locations found in the system System generated with receipt

Used to link values to activity in different locations.

name: area_grouping_stop_activity_code
description: Area grouping stop code [områdegruppering.stopp..kode.]

name: area_grouping_stop_activity_name
description: Area grouping stop name [områdegruppering.stopp]

name: depth_stop_activity
description:
Sea depth stop:

This is a calculated value from the system with a background in positions that the fisherman states in the report in the catch report.

System-generated zone by the Directorate of Fisheries

Automatic

Used to check activity in regulations where this is relevant.

name: distance_activity
description: Distance of set, meters [trekkavstand]

name: pumped_vessel
description:
Pumped from vessel: Transferred from

The radio call signal the catch is transmitted from

Required if the data element for activity (AC) in Block A is entered as relocation (REL) or if catch is pumped from another vessel.

Skipper indicates the identity of the boat receiving fish

This enables cross-checking of both parties in the event of such activity.

name: fao_gear_code
description:
Gear FAO (code): Gear

FAO implement code

The skipper chooses the gear he uses in specified catch operations in the DCA. This is a required element and generates reporting of other elements.

Manual by skipper

The FAO gear list is published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website. Only valid tools can be used.

name: fao_gear_name
description:
Gear FAO: Gear

FAO implement code

The skipper chooses the gear he uses in designated catch operations in the DCA. This is a required element and generates reporting of other elements.

Manual by skipper

The FAO gear list is published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website. Only valid tools may be used.

name: fdir_gear_code
description: Norway gear code [redskap.FDIR..kode.]

name: fdir_gear_name
description: Norway gear name [redskap.FDIR]

name: fidr_gear_group_code
description: Norway gear group code [redskap...gruppe..kode.]

name: fdir_gear_group_name
description: Norway gear group name [redskap...gruppe]

name: fdir_main_gear_code
description: Norway main gear code [redskap...hovedgruppe..kode.]

name: fdir_main_gear_name
description: Norway main gear name [redskap...hovedgruppe]

name: fdir_gear_specification_code
description:
Norway Gear specification (code): Gear specification

1 = single trawl, 2 = double trawl, 3 = triple trawl, 4 = more than three trawls Required data if the vessel fishes with a trawl.

Important element for telling how much gear is in the sea

Marine research can use this for CPUE calculations.

name: fdir_gear_specification_name
description:
Norway Gear specification: Gear specification

1 = single trawl, 2 = double trawl, 3 = triple trawl, 4 = more than three trawls Required data if the vessel fishes with a trawl.

Important element for telling how much gear is in the sea

Marine research can use this for CPUE calculations.

name: mesh_size
description:
Gear mesh size: Gear size

Minimum mesh width on gears used stated in millimeters (mm).

Required if fishing with trawl, seine, seine or net.

Entered manually by skipper. Specifies dimension in tool

Used to check activity in regulations where this is relevant.

name: gear_problem_code
description:
Gear problem (code): Gear problems

1 = boom throw, 2 = groove burst, 3 = split, 4 = hole in bag, 5 = lost tool, 6 = other

Known main causes of gear problems and is required if problems arise with the gear with which the fishing operations are carried out.

Covers the various problems the vessels may have with their gear.

Value 5 is used by the Directorate of Fisheries for cleaning up gear in the sea.

name: gear_problem_name
description:
Gear problem: Gear problems

1 = boom throw, 2 = groove burst, 3 = split, 4 = hole in bag, 5 = lost tool, 6 = other

Known main causes of gear problems and is required if problems arise with the gear with which the fishing operations are carried out.

Covers the various problems the vessels may have with their gear.

Value 5 is used by the Directorate of Fisheries for cleaning up gear in the sea.

name: gear_quantity
description:
Gear quantity: Effort

Number of hooks or total length of yarn (metres) collected per day. PD: required if the vessel fishes with line or net.

Manually inserted by the skipper using special tools

Filled in by the system on board.

name: fao_main_species_code
description:
Main species FAO (code): Main species stated on the FAO fish species code

Main species given in estimated weight in kilograms round weight. Species that have been fished the most according to the report.


Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

The value is retrieved from a list.

List published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website.

name: fao_main_species_name
description:
Main species FAO: Main species stated on the FAO fish species code

Main species given in estimated weight in kilograms round weight. Species that have been fished the most according to the report.


Value is selected from table in on-board application. Required field.

The value is retrieved from a list.

List published on the Directorate of Fisheries' website.

name: fdir_main_species_code
description: Fdir main species code [hovedart...FDIR..kode.]

name: fao_species_code
description:
Species FAO (code): FAO fish species

Fish species stated with a three-letter code according to FAO's abbreviations.

Required if you have stated that you have a catch (CA) in a catch operation,

Important element selected by a species list

Various applications have functionality around the selection of species and favorites to help the Skipper with completion

name: fao_species_name
description:
Species FAO: FAO fish species

Fish species stated with a three-letter code according to FAO's abbreviations.

Required if you have stated that you have a catch (CA) in a catch operation,

Important element selected by a species list

Various applications have functionality around the selection of species and favorites to help the Skipper with completion

name: fdir_species_code
description: Fdir species code [art...FDIR..kode.]

name: fdir_species_name
description: Fdir species name [art...FDIR]

name: species_group_code
description: Species group code [art...gruppe..kode.]

name: species_group_name
description: Species group name [art...gruppe]

name: species_main_group_code
description: Species main group code [art...hovedgruppe..kode.]

name: species_main_group
description: Species main group [art...hovedgruppe]

name: herring_stock_code
description:
Herring stock (code): Catch specification

NOR01 = Norwegian spring-spawning herring. NOR02 = North Sea herring. PD: required if the field CA contains HER (Norwegian spring-spawning herring or North Sea herring).

Element to separate Herring in terms of management

The skipper selects this manually.

Included in the National regulations in addition to bilateral nations that fish in the NE

name: herring_stock
description:
Herring stock: Catch specification

NOR01 = Norwegian spring-spawning herring. NOR02 = North Sea herring. PD: required if the field CA contains HER (Norwegian spring-spawning herring or North Sea herring).

Element to separate Herring in terms of management

The skipper selects this manually.

Included in the National regulations in addition to bilateral nations that fish in the NE

name: fdir_herring_stock_code
description: Fdir herring stock code [sildebestand...FDIR..kode.]

name: weigth_kg
description:
Round weight: Weight in kilograms (round weight)

Catch in kilograms of round weight per species of fish

Required if you have stated that you have a catch (CA) in a catch operation,

Entered by the skipper depending on the size of the catch per species.

Estimated extraction of resources per species.

name: individual_number
description:
Individual number: Individual number

Value 1-999 per year.

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7).


The same IN that is sent manually in error situations must be used when the message is registered and resent

Takes part in keeping accounts of how many animals are taken and provides the administration with tracking on an individual level.

name: species_sex_code
description:
Gender (code): Gender

When capturing male animals, 1 is entered, female animals are entered 2.

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Laid down

The element only applies to whaling.

name: species_sex
description:
Gender: Gender

When capturing male animals, 1 is entered, female animals are entered 2.

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Laid down

The element only applies to whaling.

name: species_length
description:
Length: Length

The length of the animal must be entered in centimeters (cm).

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Placed manually

The element only applies to whaling.

name: species_circumference
description:
Circumference: Circumference

The animal's circumference must be recorded in centimeters (cm)

PD: required if data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7) or lost whale (GP=8).

Placed manually

The element only applies to whaling.

name: species_bacon_a
description:
Bacon measure A: Bacon measure

3 (A, B and C) blubber measurements of the animal must be recorded in millimeters (mm).

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Entered manually by the skipper after physical measurement at predefined points. The measurements say something about the condition of the animal that has been caught.

name: species_bacon_b
description:
Bacon measure B: Bacon measure

4 (A, B and C) blubber measurements of the animal must be recorded in millimeters (mm).

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Entered manually by the skipper after physical measurement at predefined points. The measurements say something about the condition of the animal that has been caught.

name: species_bacon_c
description:
Bacon measure C: Bacon measure

5 (A, B and C) blubber measurements of the animal must be entered in millimeters (mm).

PD: required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon) and there is no boom shot (GP=7)
or lost whale (GP=8)

Entered manually by the skipper after physical measurement at predefined points. The measurements say something about the condition of the animal that has been caught.

name: species_fetal_length
description:
Fetal length: Length of fetus

Fetal length in centimeters (cm)

PD: required if data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon).

Placed manually

The element only applies to whaling.

name: species_grenade_number
description:
Grenade number: Grenade number

Number of grenade used during capture operation.

Required if the data element GE in Block B is given as HAR (harpoon).

Entered manually by skipper. Unique number.

Used to keep track of shells used in whaling.

name: vessel_id
description: Unique identifier for vessels - system-generated ID number of 10 digits

name: registry
description:
REGISTRATION MARK

Format FF0000KK. Some registration marks have old codes for county and municipality, the registration mark is therefore not a reliable source for determining municipality affiliation. For this, the MUNICIPALITY NUMBER field must be used.

name: callsign
description:
RADIO CALLING SIGNAL

Max 8 characters

name: shipname
description:
NAME

Max 32 characters

name: vessel_municipality_code
description:
MUNICIPALITY NUMBER

4 digits

name: vessel_municipality
description: Vessel city [fartøykommune]

name: vessel_county_code
description: Vessel county code [fartøyfylke..kode.]

name: vessel_county
description: Vessel county [fartøyfylke]

name: length_max
description:
GREATEST_LENGTH

Up to 2 decimal places

name: length_group_code
description: Length group code [lengdegruppe..kode.]

name: length_group
description: Length group [lengdegruppe]

name: gross_tonnage_1969
description:
GROSS TONNAGE_1969

Gross tonnage according to the London Convention of 1969, integer

name: gross_tonnage
description:
GROSS TONNAGE_OTHER

Gross tonnage according to another convention, integer

name: year_construction
description: Year of construction [byggeår]

name: year_renovation
description: Renovation year [ombyggingsår]

name: engine_power
description:
MOTOR POWER

Measured in HP

name: engine_year
description:
ENGINE BUILD YEAR

Year, 4 digits

name: hull_material
description:
HULL MATERIALS

Possible values:

ALUMINUM, FERROSECMENT, COMPOSITE, PLASTIC, STEEL, WOOD

name: width
description:
WIDTH

Up to 2 decimal places

name: authorization_start
description: Start authorization [fartøy.gjelder.fra.dato]

name: authorization_end
description: End authorization [fartøy.gjelder.til.dato]

name: vessel_identification
description: Vessel indetification - concatenation of shipname;callsign;norway registry [fartøyidentifikasjon]

name: length
description: Length [fartøylengde]

name: message_timestamp_month
description: Year and Month when the message was sent in UTC. Used for partitioning
